To all that would like to know:

Look to the WHO and/or CDC for information. Simple

Wash your hands often, disinfect your phones often too. Masks are effective in some manner if you suck at covering your mouth when you cough. If you are sick at all, wear a mask to protect those around you. But you should know that standard procedure masks will not do much to prevent you from getting any virus. The CDC recommends hand washing as the best thing you can do. Viruses are very small and will go through every opening around the sides of the mask. If wearing a mask makes you feel better then sure, but you should leave them for the patients who are sick and for health care workers who are exposed on a daily basis.

Main take home message... If you have known contact with a COVID-19 confirmed or SUSPECTED patient, you should stay home and self quarantine for 14 days. Call the department of health for your state and explain your situation. DO NOT GO TO THE DOCTORS (YOU'LL JUST SPREAD IT... THAT IS NOT QUARANTINE) . DO NOT GO TO THE ER UNLESS YOU ARE EXPERIENCING LIFE THREATHENING SYMPTOMS.

If your oxygen is below 95%, take some deep breaths if you can to see if it improves. If your oxygen is below 90%... GO TO THE ER. If you dont have a pulse ox, evaulaute yourself. Are you are truly having actual difficulty breathing?...GO TO THE ER. That doesn't mean your nose is stuffy and you cannot breath through your nose.

Take over the counter medications. Tylenol (acetaminophen) and ibuprofen to control fever and some associated aches and pains. Take mucinex DM and decongestant meds for congestion, coughing, and drainage. Take care of yourself. Try to go to sleep for at least 8-10 hours a night. Rest and do not infect others.

Quarantine means stay out of the public and stay indoors away from other non infected ppl. 80-85% of people who will get COVID-19 will recover without any issues. If you are 65 yrs old or older then you are at a higher risk. If you have comorbidities then you are at a higher risk. If you are 80 yrs old and above then you are at a much higher risk. Couple this with asthma, COPD, CHF, Sarcoidosis, Diabetes, and/or cancer, then you may want to actually worry about COVID-19. This means stay indoors. Especially if you are within these age ranges and with these health conditions. Don't be stupid and most importantly, don't be blinded by fear.

Fear is the death of logic. Logic can prevent death and logic can illegitimize fear.

Best of luck to you all

COVID-19 (2019-nCoV): Hypochlorous Acid (150ppm) achieved > 5 log reduction in FCV titres in less than a minute!

What is Hypochlorous Acid?

Hypochlorous Acid is used in many industries including Hospitality, Food service, Grocery/ Retail, Post harvest vegetable production, Hydroponics, and Medical services.

ECA Water (Electrochemically Activated Water) water is made by passing low-voltage electricity through saltwater (Sodium Chloride) in the ECA-1 and splitting the Sodium ions (Catholyte) from the Chlorine ions (Anolyte – Hypochlorous acid).

Is it safe? 

When any mammal’s body comes under attack from invading bacteria and viruses, the body’s immune system immediately responds by sending white blood cells called Neutrophil to the invasion site.

Once activated, these cells produce substantial quantities of Hypochlorous acid (HOCI) a chemical that is acknowledged to be among the most potent natural disinfectants, highly effective in eliminating all invading microbes and pathogens, yet it remains non-toxic to humans and other mammals.

Hypochlorous acid is proven to be safe, environmentally friendly, and fast acting against a broad range of resistant pathogens, including MRSA, M.tuberculosis, Legionella, E.coli, HIV, Poliovirus, Helicobacter Pylori ...

Well to set some things straight the words Pandemic and Epidemic are Greek words (i'm Greek, so i know...). Epidemic is Επιδημία - Επί (upon)+ Δήμος (population) so infection upon a local population.On the other hand Pandemic is Πανδημία - Παν (the whole, everybody) + Δήμος (population), so infection is upon the whole population - widespread.

BTW Δήμος (the people) is the same root as in Democracy (Δήμος + Κράτος) power or rule by the people.

I wish he'd have mentioned why masks are not very useful. But I will. It is very effective at stopping aerosol droplets from your sneezes, coughs, and talking from spreading into the air. That is the main route of infection. And sneezing into your mask instead of your hands reduces how many viral particles you leave on the doorknob too. But masks are semi-permeable, and as they get moist from your breath, any viral particles or bacteria landing on the outside of them quickly travel to the opposite side, which is in close contact with your mouth and nose. So they are very limited in preventing you from getting sick - mostly while they are still dry.
